answers.answer: At 28 weeks, I was hospitalized for lower left back pain that had kept me up all night, it had been preceeded by braxton hicks.  At first they thought it was a kidney stone, but all my test came back clear.  They gave me iv fluids and the pain began to ease.  My doctor believes it was dehydration...since then I have been placed on bedrest and increased my water intake by one gallon more a day and have not had an issue since. I am now 31 weeks.  For some reason (possibly my diabetes) I need to drink twice the amount of fluids.

I'll try that! I only drink water, juice, and gingerale. But, I'll cut that down to just water and see what it does. I have an awesome doctor but he's very old school.. like suck it up girl it's only gonna get worse old school.. haha. But I'm glad things have subsided for you!
most likely your Sciatic nerve . i also had this problem does it get worse when you stand or walk?

No it stays the same. I shake sometimes it hurts so bad. I can't even get up without falling to my knees so I sit with my elbows on my knees with my hips and legs spread a tad to even out my weight.. nothing has worked.
Let me know if it helps you.  I know the pain for me was awful the extra water really helped me, so the extra bathroom runs are a small price.
Thanks I will! I've drank 3 glasses of water since you told me that. Haha.
